oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Citizen's claim for supplies destroyed by Union troops
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: John H. Kell's reimbursement claim for $302.90 for stores "destroyed by the Federal Army." Item is in a ledger book and is signed by the Clerk of the County Court. An itemized listing of stores and valuations are listed, incl. 64 bushels corn, 4 bee; hives, and pork taken or damaged by US forces. John Hewitt Kell (1830-1880) was the second husband of Eunice C. "Nicey" Vandergriff (1835-1915). Her first husband, James Noah Levi (1833-1864) died in Andersonville Prison.
